content:
The world is about to be saved by two extraordinary young heroes: Sadie Stanley and Sean Giambrone, who will star as Kim Possible and Ron Stoppable in the upcoming live-action movie based on the beloved animated series.

Kim Possible is the story of a high school girl who, in her spare time, saves the world from evil villains. But this is no ordinary high school girl - she's a girl with an extraordinary spirit, who delivers Kim's confidence, smarts, and agility with aplomb.

Sadie Stanley, a 16-year-old from South Carolina, landed the role in her first-ever audition. She has since guest-starred on Game Shakers, and we can't wait to see her bring Kim's spirit to life.

Sean Giambrone, 18, stars in ABC's hit comedy The Goldbergs and will film Kim Possible before returning to production of that series. He's a magnetic actor who always finds the right balance of physical comedy and heart, and we know he'll bring Ron's heart to the screen.

The movie will be directed by Adam B. Stein and Zach Lipovsky, who were finalists on Fox's directing competition On the Lot. Blyth Nailling is the casting director, and the script will be written by Emmy-winning series creators and executive producers Mark McCorkle & Robert Schooley and Josh Cagan.

Kim Possible is an animated comedy/adventure series that launched in 2002 and followed the adventures of a strong teenager who uses her brain, heart, and expertise to save the day. Throughout 87 episodes, Kim Possible traversed the social hierarchy of high school and, with her loyal sidekick Ron Stoppable and his naked mole-rat Rufus by her side, thwarted power-hungry villains Drakken and Shego, among others.

The series inspired two popular animated original movies, Kim Possible Movie: So the Drama in 2005, which was the first animated title in the Disney Channel Original Movie franchise, and Kim Possible: A Stitch in Time in 2003. It also led to an off-TV franchise including Kim Possible and Ron Stoppable characters at Disney Parks & Resorts and a line of Kim Possible branded consumer products at mass retail, soundtracks, books, and games.

The series has been recognized with numerous awards, including the Parents' Choice Foundation, the International Animated Film Society's Annie Awards, and Italy's Pulcinella Award for Best Program and Best TV Series for Children.

This movie will be a celebration of everything we love about Kim Possible - the courage, the heart, and the extraordinary spirit of a girl who dared to be herself and save the world. We can't wait to see Sadie and Sean bring these iconic roles to life and make the world a better place, one adventure at a time.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed information provided about the upcoming live-action movie based on the Kim Possible series, including the casting of Sadie Stanley and Sean Giambrone, as well as the credentials of the directors, casting director, and scriptwriters, it is highly likely that this message is real. The information seems to be from an official source, providing specific details about the movie and its production, making it more likely to be a real message. Therefore, the prediction is 1.

After months of controversy, MTV's hit reality show "Catfish: The Show" is finally resuming production, thanks to a recent investigation that cleared its host and executive producer, Nev Schulman, of sexual misconduct allegations.

In May, a woman who appeared on the show accused Schulman of sexually harassing her during filming. Schulman denied the allegations, which led to the show's suspension.

But now, MTV has announced that the investigation found the allegations to be "not credible and without merit." As a result, "Catfish: The Show" will resume filming, with Schulman expressing his gratitude to fans for their support.

The investigation was launched after Ayissha Morgan, a former contestant on the show, went public with her accusations of being propositioned for sex by Schulman during the filming of her episode. Schulman categorically denied the allegations, saying they were "false."

Schulman has been the show's host since 2012, and the investigation has left viewers eagerly anticipating the show's return. With the controversy now behind it, "Catfish: The Show" is set to resume filming and provide viewers with more thrilling and heartwarming stories of online relationships.

The devastating news has emerged that Scott Baio will not face prosecution for the alleged sexual assault of Nicole Eggert during the run of "Charles in Charge." Sources close to the case have revealed that the Los Angeles County Deputy District Attorney, responsible for reviewing the evidence, has deemed Nicole's allegations "credible."

According to our sources, Eggert met with the D.A. in order to provide evidence that Baio repeatedly molested her between the ages of 14 and 18. Despite Baio's insistence that they had sex only once, when she was 18 years old, the D.A. has deemed the case "potentially prosecutable."

However, the statute of limitations has proven to be a major obstacle in bringing Baio to justice. At the time the alleged assaults occurred in the 1980s, the statute of limitations was three years, and as a result, it has expired.

While some argue that cases from the past could still be prosecuted if the statute had not run out when the law was changed, in this instance, the statute expired before the law was updated. With this news, the hope of justice for Nicole has been extinguished.

In a heartbreaking statement to TMZ, Eggert says, "I always knew this case was beyond statutes of limitations and unfortunately the DA would not be able to prosecute Scott Baio. However, I also knew the importance of laying the groundwork for any future victims of Baio's that may come forward and to warn parents who might unknowingly allow their children to be alone with this molester."

Eggert continues, "I could no longer keep up the lie he conditioned me into and felt it was a Mother's responsibility to put the truth out there." Her bravery in speaking out about her experience is a testament to the power of survivors and the need for change in a society that allows perpetrators to walk free.

The details provided about the allegations against Scott Baio, the involvement of the Los Angeles County Deputy District Attorney, and the statute of limitations align with real-life events. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.

New Girl's series finale, which aired on May 15th, 2018, was a bittersweet moment for fans of the show. After seven seasons of watching Jess, Nick, Schmidt, Cece, Winston, and Aly navigate their way through the ups and downs of life in their Los Angeles loft, it was finally time to say goodbye.

For many viewers, New Girl had its perfect series finale at the end of season 6, when Jess and Nick shared a sweet, passionate kiss after repeated failed attempts to end up in the same place in their loft. The series finale, however, decided to take a different approach.

The finale of New Girl was split into two distinct parts, each bringing a different but equally important sense of closure to the series. The first half, 'The Curse of the Pirate Bride', was a payoff to seven seasons worth of on-again, off-again romantic tension between Nick and Jess. The episode unfolds like an anxiety dream, with Jess and Nick facing obstacles at every turn, including Jess's mom showing up to chastise the couple for spending the night before their wedding together.

The second half, 'Engram Pattersky', sees the group of friends reluctantly packing their belongings as they prepare to leave the loft. The episode teeters on the verge of becoming a trip down memory lane, with Jess insisting that the core group gather to help pack since she and Nick are being evicted.

In the end, New Girl's finale delivered both the wedding that was promised and the goodbye that was needed, without letting the audience down. The show's finale is a testament to the power of spending time with these weird, lovably obnoxious people, and for one final time, Liz Meriwether and the New Girl crew figured out a satisfying way to make that what fans will ultimately remember the show for.

EXCLUSIVE: Terry Crews Files Lawsuit Against Hollywood Agent for Alleged Sexual Assault!

The stunning sexual assault case involving Terry Crews has taken a dramatic turn as the actor has filed a lawsuit against his alleged attacker, William Morris Endeavor agent Adam Venit. Crews has accused Venit of assault, battery, and sexual harassment, among other charges, in a lawsuit filed in Los Angeles Superior Court.

The lawsuit comes just a month after Crews made his allegations public on Twitter, though not naming Venit specifically. After Crews' allegation, Venit was suspended from WME and was later demoted to a lower-level role within the company.

The alleged incident occurred on Feb. 4, 2016, at an industry event hosted by Adam Sandler. According to the complaint obtained by USA TODAY, Venit stared at Crews intently, like a rabid dog, sticking his tongue in and out of his mouth provocatively. Venit then viciously grabbed Crews' penis and testicles, causing him immediate pain. Crews shoved Venit back, knocking him into several people who were standing nearby. However, Venit continued to leer at Crews and grabbed and squeezed his genitals again. Crews says he asked Sandler for help, and Sandler was shocked by Venit's behavior.

Crews, a WME client before he formally left the company in mid-November, says he informed his agent at the company the next day, but the agency took little action. The lawsuit alleges that WME agents are knowingly permitted and encouraged to engage in sexually predatory conduct in order to assert their power and clout over others.

Crews is seeking punitive and exemplary damages for the alleged assault, which he says caused him actual pain as well as psychological issues. Venit's client roster includes several Hollywood names who have been accused of harassment, including Sylvester Stallone, Casey Affleck, Brett Ratner, and Dustin Hoffman.

This is a developing story, and Crews' lawsuit has been reported by multiple outlets, including TMZ and Deadline Hollywood. Stay tuned for further updates.

Mama June Shannon, star of the reality TV show Mama June: From Not to Hot, has revealed that she is ready to take the next step in her relationship with Geno Doak. In an emotional Instagram post, Shannon shared a throwback photo of the couple, taken two years ago after her gastric sleeve surgery, and opened up about her desire for marriage.

“I know people have asked but me and Geno r not married are real names are June Shannon and Geno Doak so you can look anywhere as that is public record n yes on the show it was real when I gave him the ultimatum our show is not scripted we bring the real back into reality,?she wrote.

She admitted that Doak is the first person she has ever thought about wanting to spend the rest of her life with because he makes not just her but the girls happy too, and that she hopes he will give her the commitment she is looking for. Shannon realizes that Doak is nervous about proposing, but she is ready to take that next step in their relationship.

“A girl can always dream I know that he is scared but at this point I am honestly looking to take that next step in our relationship,?she said. “It really hurt me to actually say either step up or I’m going to have to walk away but I know my girls want the best for me and I know that he is little scared as he was married for many years and I am only his second serious relationship his whole entire life.”

Despite her desire for marriage, Shannon is understanding of Doak's nerves about proposing. She hopes that he will come around because she honestly does love him with all of her heart and is happy with him as they are together 24/7.

Fans first met Doak in January, when Shannon introduced him to viewers and her two youngest children: Alana “Honey Boo Boo?Thompson, 13, and Lauryn “Pumpkin?Shannon, 18. After a few months of dating, Shannon asked Doak to move in with her and her daughters, and he quickly became a part of the family.

In an episode that aired last month, Shannon was open about her desire to tie the knot with Doak. Mama June: From Not to Hot airs Fridays (9 p.m. ET) on WE tv.

Sunday night marked a monumental occasion for the theater world as the 71st annual Tony Awards took place, honoring the best in musical and play productions. The musical "Dear Evan Hansen" emerged as the big winner, taking home the top prize for best musical, and its star, Ben Platt, won lead actor for his outstanding performance. As he accepted the award, Platt gave an emotional and heartfelt speech, leaving audiences in tears.

Not to be outdone, Bette Midler and the revival of "Hello, Dolly!" took home lead actress and best revival of a musical, respectively. Midler gave a memorable and touching speech of her own.

Other big winners included "Oslo" for best play and "August Wilson's Jitney" for best revival of a play. Kevin Spacey hosted the ceremony, which aired live on CBS from Radio City Music Hall in New York.

Jennifer Lawrence, the beloved actress known for her relatable nature, shared a heart-wrenching story about a night of alcohol-fueled rage. The Mother! star appeared on Late Night With Seth Meyers, hoping to dull the hangover from attending a movie premiere the night before. However, things took a turn when a fan rudely asked for a selfie with her.

"I was drunk, which is rare," Lawrence admitted with a laugh. "This guy asked me for a selfie and I was like, 'No. Thank you. No.' He was like, 'Please! My girlfriend will never believe me.' My friend was like, 'If your girlfriend won't believe you then she's not The One.'"

The fan's response only escalated the situation, and a bar fight ensued. "Something in me just snapped ?but it couldn't have been the alcohol," Lawrence said. "I grabbed him, I took beers and I started dousing him, all over him."

But things didn't end there. The fan also had a suitcase, and Lawrence quickly made sure that was drenched in beer as well. "I was like, 'Is that your sh-t?!' I started pouring beers all over his suitcase. My friend Chris came up, grabbed me from behind and goes, 'Don't waste beer! Don't waste beer!' I instantly relaxed. I was like, 'Of course! What was I thinking?'"

This story is a reminder that even the most relatable people can lose control in certain situations. It's important to remember that we all have our breaking points, and it's okay to make mistakes as long as we learn from them.

In court documents filed on Tuesday, Angelina Jolie's attorneys allege that Brad Pitt has not paid any "meaningful" child support since their separation. They are seeking a court order for retroactive funds. NBC News obtained the documents, which were filed in Los Angeles Superior Court, in which Jolie's lawyers request a status conference with a judge.

According to Jolie's attorney Samantha Bley DeJean, Pitt has a duty to pay child support, but as of present, he has paid no meaningful child support since their separation. However, a person familiar with the situation disputes this claim, stating that Pitt has fulfilled his commitments.

Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt have six children together: Maddox, 17; Pax, 14; Zahara, 13; Shiloh, 12; and 10-year old twins Vivienne and Knox. In September 2016, Jolie filed for divorce, citing the separation as "for the health of the family." The couple then battled publicly over custody of their children for months, until they released a joint statement in January 2017, saying they had agreed to handle their divorce in a private forum and would work together to reunify their family. However, their custody struggle re-emerged in June 2018, and a judge determined that their children's lack of a relationship with their father is harmful to them. Jolie continues to be represented by divorce lawyer Laura Wasser, while Pitt has been represented by Lance Spiegel.

A father of a prominent celebrity has expressed concerns about the quality of life in the Upper West Side neighborhood of New York City due to the presence of a migrant dormitory. The resident, who has lived in the area for 35 years and owns a local restaurant, claims that the situation has rapidly deteriorated since the arrival of 500 migrants at the Stratford Arms Hotel, which was converted into a shelter.

The resident asserts that migrants are throwing block parties late into the night, riding e-bikes and scooters on one-way streets, and engaging in prostitution. He also claims that girls as young as 14 are being catcalled, and residents are experiencing verbal abuse. The resident further complains about the accumulation of trash, the drop in property values, and the feeling of helplessness among the residents.

The resident believes that the migrants are being housed in 400 rooms that are too small for a bed and a refrigerator and that everyone shares bathrooms, which is a typical college dorm setup. He suggests that the city should have suspended "sanctuary city" status until adequate housing was available and then allowed more migrants, instead of sending them to a cruise ship, which would be a more controlled environment.

The resident is advocating for better policing and supervision of the migrants and is lobbying City Hall for solutions to the issues that have arisen.

Tom Brady, the beloved quarterback of the New England Patriots, has released a new book in which he reveals his secrets to staying sun-safe. In the book, he writes about how he credits his ability to avoid sunburns to the amount of water he drinks.

As a fair-skinned Irish boy, Tom often got sunburned as a child. But now, even if he spends time in the sun, he rarely gets a burn. He attributes this to his water consumption, as he believes that staying hydrated helps protect the skin from the harmful effects of the sun.

While we agree that drinking plenty of water is an important part of a healthy diet, we must emphasize that there is no scientific evidence to support the claim that drinking water can prevent sunburns. In fact, many medical authorities, including the American Academy of Dermatology, the Center for Disease Control, the Mayo Clinic, the Cleveland Clinic, and the Skin Cancer Foundation, all recommend using sunscreen and other protective measures to prevent sunburns.

Tom's advice to drink water to prevent sunburns may be amusing to some, but it is not a reliable or effective method of sun protection. To truly protect yourself from the sun, it is important to follow the advice of experts and use a high-quality sunscreen, seek shade when possible, cover up with clothing and hats, avoid the middle of the day when the sun's rays are strongest, and wear sunglasses to protect your eyes.

While we understand that spending time in the sun can be enjoyable, it is important to prioritize your health and take the necessary precautions to protect yourself from the sun's harmful effects. For more information on how to stay safe in the sun, please refer to our Suncare Smarts articles and our Skin Care posts.

Meghan Markle, who is now known as the Duchess of Sussex, was still commonly referred to as "Meg" by her makeup artist and friend Daniel Martin. Martin, who helped Meghan achieve her perfect beauty look for her wedding day to Prince Harry, revealed that even he was confused about what to call her after the marriage. When Martin asked Meghan what she wanted him to call her, she simply laughed and said, "I'm always going to be Meg. Meg." Martin added that he will be respectful and follow protocol next time he sees Meghan and her husband, but he will always refer to her as "Meg."

During the preparation for Meghan's wedding, Martin was one of only five people present, along with the bride, hair stylist Serge Normant, dress designer Clare Waight Keller, and Meghan's mother Doria Ragland, who was in good spirits. The atmosphere was relaxed, with Meghan playing 1950s music to keep everyone calm. Meghan was not nervous and remained her usual self, according to Martin.

The wedding dress was the moment when the reality of the situation hit for Martin and the rest of the team. "It was all so easy. It didn't hit us that she was getting married until she got the dress on," Martin said. The dress was described as beautiful and architectural, and when Meghan put it on, it felt like a glove. The sight of the veil and crown brought the moment to life.

Martin got emotional when he saw Meghan after the ceremony for their official portraits. "That's when I started crying," he explained. "It was the first time I was able to be there in person. It was almost like she looked at me and said, 'What did you think? How'd it go?' And I lost it." He added that the day was perfect and couldn't have been better.

However, this absence is not solely due to the exclusion of white men. Alternative rock band Garbage, led by lead singer Shirley Manson, has also been making waves in the music industry. In fact, if you count Garbage and search through every other album of the year category since the Grammys started in 1959, this actually marks the first time in history that no white men have been nominated for the night's biggest prize.

This achievement is especially significant for the Grammys, which saw lots of criticism last year when Adele's "25" won over Beyoncé's "Lemonade." The year before that, Taylor Swift's "1989" beat Lamar's "To Pimp a Butterfly." And the year before that, Beyoncé's self-titled album lost to Beck's "Morning Phase."

Recording Academy president Neil Portnow acknowledged the diversity of this year's nominees and credited it to the large pool of voting members; there are about 13,000 overall. Plus, the Grammys opened up online voting for the first time this year, which led to a wider range of ballots than usual.

"The results are reflecting the music of the times ?hip-hop and urban music is pervasive in our society worldwide ?not just in America," Portnow said. "So when that continues to be evident and evolve, this is a reflection of that."

He also explained that Sheeran being relegated to the pop album category is not necessarily a snub but simply indicative of where the voters thought he belonged.

"In terms of Ed and the recordings he made, certainly our voters thought highly of him and he is nominated [for two awards]. In terms of where he’s nominated, that’s our members?call and I have to respect that," Portnow added.

The Grammy Awards will air on CBS on January 28th.

In a shocking turn of events, former Olympic gymnastics doctor Larry Nassar was sentenced to a minimum of 40 years in prison on Wednesday for molesting young girls under the guise of medical treatment. The sentence was handed down by Judge Rosemarie Aquilina in a Michigan courtroom where Nassar had listened to victims for seven days before learning his fate.

"You do not deserve to walk outside of a prison ever again," Aquilina said before handing down the sentence. "I just signed your death warrant."

Nassar, 54, had already agreed to a minimum 40-year sentence when he pleaded guilty to seven counts of first-degree criminal sexual misconduct in Ingham County. He still faces sentencing in Eaton County for three more counts, and he has already been sentenced to 60 years in federal prison for possession of child pornography.

Before the sentence was handed down, Nassar was given the opportunity to speak. He tearfully apologized to the victims, saying that their statements had shaken him to the core. However, his apology was met with skepticism by Aquilina, who took out a six-page letter he had sent to the court in which he claimed that what he did to the victims was medical and not sexual, and that he was the victim of a media frenzy.

Aquilina said she did not believe that Nassar was truly taking responsibility for his actions. She asked him if he would like to withdraw his plea and ask for a trial, but he declined.

After the hearing, some victims struggled to put into words their feelings about the sentence. "It's overwhelming," one victim said. "This whole process has been so long and so difficult, and so to finally have some answers and finally have this all culminate into one day: it's a lot to take in."

Nassar was the team doctor for USA Gymnastics for two decades and had a busy sports medicine practice at Michigan State University. Both institutions have been criticized for how they handled allegations against him before they became public. On Wednesday night, the president of MSU resigned in support of an investigation into Nassar's misconduct.

Lindsey Marie Morgan, a talented American actress, was born on February 27, 1990, in Georgia, United States. She is of half-Mexican and half-Irish descent and has an older brother, a half-sister, and five step-siblings. Morgan's acting career began in college at the University of Texas at Austin, where she was busy booking commercials and print ads. After leaving college, she moved to Los Angeles to pursue her dream of becoming an actress.

Morgan's first major role was in the movie Detention, where she played a mean cheerleader named Alexis. She then landed the leading role in the MTV film DisCONNECTED, as social media obsessed Maria, as part of the MTV "A Thin Line" campaign. Her acting skills were recognized when she was nominated for the Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series in 2013.

After leaving her role on General Hospital, Morgan filmed a web series called Destroy the Alpha Gammas. She also had a supporting role in the indie movie Chastity Bites and starred in the film series "Skyline."

Morgan's most significant role was as Raven Reyes on The CW science fiction drama series The 100, which ended after seven seasons. For this role, she was praised for her portrayal of a strong and confident character. She also starred in the television film Casa Vita and the independent thriller Lasso, where she showed her range and depth as an actress.

Morgan is currently engaged to actor Shaun Sipos and they are set to marry on September 21, 2023, in Austin, Texas. She continues to work in the entertainment industry and her talent and dedication to her craft are admired by many.

The father of pop sensation Lady Gaga has unleashed a blistering attack on the hundreds of migrants being housed in a New York City hotel just steps away from his Upper West Side home.

Joe Germanotta, who runs the successful Joanne Trattoria eatery in the area and has lived in the affluent neighborhood for 35 years, told the New York Post that the situation has gone from bad to worse since the Stratford Arms Hotel was turned into a migrant shelter six weeks ago.

According to Joe, the migrants have been throwing block parties until the early hours of the morning, riding recklessly on one-way streets on e-bikes and scooters, and evidence of prostitution has emerged. Girls as young as 14 have been catcalled, and residents are dealing with verbal abuse, he claimed.

The migrants, Joe said, are being housed in 400 rooms that are only large enough for a bed and refrigerator, with everyone sharing bathrooms - a typical college dorm setup. Joe believes that about 500 migrants are living in the hotel, and that they are "locked into very small rooms and when they get out, they go out at night, and they party."

Joe's biggest issue, however, is not that the migrants are in his neighborhood. He believes that the city isn't dealing with the issues that have emerged and isn't restoring order. He added, "I don't mind having them there. They're gonna be there for three years. That was the contract, I understand. But at least manage it. Put the proper security in place, have a police presence and a code of conduct."

Joe is also calling for the mayor to suspend "sanctuary city" status until enough housing is available, and instead, use the money that would be spent on housing to build cruise ships - which would provide a more controlled environment.

Joe's outspoken criticism of the situation has been met with support from other residents in the area, who are also pushing for better policing and supervision.
td_rationale: This message appears to be a real account of the father of Lady Gaga expressing his concerns about the situation of migrants being housed in a hotel near his home. The detailed description of the migrants' behavior and the call for action from the city authorities suggests that the message is based on genuine events. Additionally, the fact that other residents in the area are supporting Joe's criticism further adds to the credibility of the message. Therefore, it is more likely to be a real message, and I would return 1.
cs_rationale:
Veracity: 1

Based on the information provided in the message, it is more likely to be a real message. The details about the father of Lady Gaga expressing his concerns about the migrants being housed in a New York City hotel, the specific issues he raises, and the call for better policing and supervision are specific and provide a level of credibility to the message.

In a shocking turn of events, Kylie Jenner broke the Met Gala's "no selfie rule" at the star-studded annual event on Monday night! The social media sensation, who was dressed in a stunning Versace gown, posed for an epic bathroom selfie with Kim Kardashian West, Lily Aldridge, and Brie Larson.

But that wasn't all! Kylie was joined by none other than A$AP Rocky, Sean "Diddy" Combs, Paris Jackson, Kendall Jenner, Frank Ocean, and Ashton Sanders for the impromptu photoshoot. The photo quickly went viral, with Larson later joking about how a trip to the bathroom made her famous.

Despite the "no social media" policy in place since 2015, sources tell E! Online that the rule was not taken as seriously this year. The policy was initially introduced to ensure the safety and enjoyment of guests, but clearly, celebrities have found ways to work around it.

The annual Costume Institute exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art is always a fashion spectacle, attracting the biggest names in Hollywood, fashion, and music. This year's theme was "Rei Kawakubo/Comme des Garçons: Art of the In-Between," honoring the avant-garde designer.

But what really made headlines was Kylie's bold move at the event. Will other celebrities follow her lead and break the selfie rule at future Met Gala events? Stay tuned to find out!

Jordan Feldstein, a long-time manager for Maroon 5 and the brother of actor Jonah Hill, has passed away at the age of 40. The cause of death was a heart attack, according to the Feldstein family, who confirmed his death with the Los Angeles County coroner.

Feldstein founded Career Artist Management (CAM), a management company based in Beverly Hills, California. He began his career in the industry by working for ICM and Bill Leopold Management, and later formed a friendship with Maroon 5's lead vocalist, Adam Levine. Feldstein managed Maroon 5 from the band's inception, guiding them to success as one of the most popular international touring acts, with three Grammy Awards and 20 million albums sold worldwide.

He was also a father to two children and was previously married twice, once to Francesca Eastwood, daughter of Clint Eastwood, in 2013, which was annulled.

A statement from the Feldstein family reads: "Unfortunately, last night Jordan called 911 for shortness of breath. When paramedics arrived, it was determined that he went into full cardiac arrest and passed away shortly thereafter."

The family asks for privacy during this difficult and unexpected time, and will announce a charity in the coming weeks where memorial donations can be made in Jordan's name. Live Nation and Roc Nation, with whom CAM was strategically aligned, also released a statement, expressing their deep sadness at Jordan's passing and extending their heartfelt condolences to his family and friends.

It contains specific details about Jordan Feldstein's career and personal life, including his management of Maroon 5, his previous marriages, and his sudden passing due to a heart attack at the age of 40. The family's statement and the expressions of condolences from Live Nation and Roc Nation add authenticity to the message. Additionally, the reference to future charity announcements in Jordan's name further indicates the veracity of the message. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.

The Vanderpump Rules Season 6 has been filled with more drama than one could possibly keep track of. Just this morning, we learned that Faith Stowers faked being pregnant with Jax Taylor’s baby in order to land a spot on the show. And now, the afternoon is keeping pace with some old-fashioned, skinny-shaming, joke-missing outrage, all centered around an interview Stassi Schroeder gave to Daily Mail Australia.

When asked how she maintains her trim figure, despite a schedule that seems pretty well packed with work and social obligations, Stassi had this to say: "I’m really lazy," she told the outlet. "I stay thin by trying to starve myself for the most part, if I’m being honest. When I’m home in Los Angeles, it’s like one meal a day."

This is a heartbreaking example of the danger of print interviews. If Stassi had tearfully confessed that she starves herself, the Mail would’ve said so. As it is, they didn’t describe her inflection at all, so we think it’s safe to say that Stassi wasn’t actually opening up to a group of Aussie strangers about her eating disorder, but was instead simply joking.

But her diet is far from the most dramatic element of Stassi’s life these days. On last night’s episode of Vanderpump, viewers finally got to meet her longtime on-again, off-again boyfriend, Patrick Meagher. Because people on the internet are easily confused, the appearance sparked rumors that Stassi and Patrick are back together. But, as far as we know, that’s not true, which is a good thing, as dude is a chronic mansplainer and he looks like Riff Raff.

Get you a man that looks like Khal Drogo and knows how to mix up a top-notch strawberry margarita, girl!

Watch Vanderpump Rules online to get caught up on what’s already been one hell of a drama-packed season.

Charlie Hunnam, star of the TV series Sons of Anarchy, recently spoke with Screen Daily about his experiences working on the film The Lost City of Z. In the interview, he revealed that he had difficulty forming a bond with his co-star, Robert Pattinson.

“I had a couple of rehearsal sessions with Sienna Miller, but I didn’t spend any time with Tom Holland or Robert,?he said. “I wanted these relationships to evolve naturally on screen, through the work. I don’t think I said more than ten words to Robert off camera.”

Hunnam wasn't sure if Pattinson was simply focused on his role or if he didn't care to form a friendship. He described their interactions as "a real distance between us."

Since filming wrapped last year, Hunnam has mentioned that Pattinson has made some attempts to connect with him. “He’s reached out to me subsequently, making overtures for us to be friends now,?he added. “So I think it was about the work.”

While filming the movie, Hunnam was focused on immersing himself in his character and the setting. He sought to avoid distractions and stay isolated while filming in the Amazon. “I was so engaged in this process of no emails, no phone ?I didn’t speak to the rest of the outside world during the duration of the shooting. When we started shooting the explorations, the others wanted to stay in my hotel, but I couldn’t break the [silent] spell. I just avoided them in the lunch room.”

The Lost City of Z is set to be released in theaters on April 14.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed information provided in the message, it is more likely to be a real message. The specific quotes and insights from Charlie Hunnam about his experiences working on the film, including his difficulty in forming a bond with co-star Robert Pattinson, the reasons behind it, and their interactions both on and off-camera, provide a sense of authenticity. Additionally, the mention of the film's release date adds to the credibility of the message. Thus, the veracity prediction for this message is 1.

A recent claim from the website Celeb Dirty Laundry suggests that Princess Eugenie is "frustrated" that she is not receiving the attention she feels she deserves for her royal work. However, Gossip Cop has investigated this claim and can confirm that it is not true.

According to the outlet, Princess Eugenie recently raised more than $600,000 for elephant and rhino charities, but the event "didn't make any headlines" as the media is focusing more on Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's upcoming royal wedding and Kate Middleton's third pregnancy. The outlet also claims that this is "frustrating" for Princess Eugenie, who has been "trying so hard to be noticed in recent weeks."

However, a royal source has told Gossip Cop that the story is "rubbish." Princess Eugenie understands that her cousins have a lot going on at the moment, particularly with engagements and pregnancies. Additionally, the princess has always lived relatively under-the-radar compared to Prince William and Prince Harry, and that isn't "frustrating" for her.

It should be noted that Gossip Cop previously corrected the outlet when it falsely claimed that Princess Eugenie and Princess Beatrice were "ignoring" the announcement of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's engagement. This latest claim about Princess Eugenie feeling "frustrated" over a "lack of attention" in the media is equally untrue.

In conclusion, the claim that Princess Eugenie is "frustrated" that she is not receiving the attention she deserves is not true.

Additionally, there is evidence of previous inaccurate reporting from the same outlet. Therefore, the message appears to be trustworthy and can be predicted as real. On January 21, 2014, Keeping Up With the Kardashians premiered its season premiere, delving into the events that led to Khloe Kardashian's decision to divorce Lamar Odom. Filmed prior to her divorce filing on December 13, the episode features Odom begging for forgiveness for his father Joe's negative comments about Kardashian's family.

Kardashian revealed that Odom was "really sad" and kept apologizing for his father's words. He also confessed that he would "kill" for her family and expressed his love for the Kardashians. Kris Jenner, Kardashian's mother, expressed her distress over the situation, stating that six months ago, Odom and Kardashian had an unbreakable bond.

Khloe Kardashian expressed her discontent with her father-in-law's comments. She stated that her family had been a support system for Odom and that she did not want them to be dragged into the situation. Kourtney Kardashian, Khloe's sister, also spoke to Odom, expressing her love and support.

Odom went so far as to send Khloe's other sister Kim Kardashian his statement regarding his father's comments, which he later tweeted on September 24. He also made several attempts to visit Khloe, including at 1 a.m., but she did not want him at the house.

Khloe later revealed that she often woke up with conflicting emotions, ranging from great moods to anger and confusion. She stated that she had to take things day by day.

content:
The college basketball season is here, and the race for Player of the Year is as wide open as we've seen in recent years. With no clear front-runner, any of the 16 players on our list could take home the award.

We put together a bracket two weeks ago and asked fans to decide who they thought was the best. The winner? Tennessee's Grant Williams, who beat Indiana's Juwan Morgan in the final round.

But Williams isn't just any player. In his sophomore campaign last season, he averaged 15.2 points, 6 rebounds, and 1.3 blocks, earning him SEC Player of the Year honors on a Tennessee team that went 26-9 overall and finished in first place in the conference with a 13-5 record.

This season, Williams will have plenty of help as he tries to lead Tennessee past the Sweet 16 for the first time since 2014. Tennessee returns all five starters and all six of its leading scorers.

Our tournament of preseason player of the year candidates featured 16 student-athletes, seeded No. 1 through No. 16, in a four-round, single-elimination format. Voting was conducted on the @MarchMadness Twitter and Instagram accounts, and the student-athlete with more fan votes in each matchup advanced to the next round.

Below are the results from each round of voting. The numbers at the end indicate the percentage of votes on Twitter:

Finals results:

(13) Grant Williams def. (15) Juwan Morgan (57-43)

Semifinals results:

(13) Grant Williams def. (1) Carsen Edwards (55-45)

(15) Juwan Morgan def. (3) Ethan Happ (52-48)

Second round results:

(1) Carsen Edwards def. (8) Caleb Martin (66-34)

(13) Grant Williams def. (5) Luke Maye (54-46)

(15) Juwan Morgan def. (7) Kyle Guy (56-44)

(3) Ethan Happ def. (6) Dedric Lawson (54-46)

First round results:

(1) Carsen Edwards def. (16) Mike Daum (68-32)

(15) Juwan Morgan def. (2) Zion Williamson (62-38)

(3) Ethan Happ def. (14) Jordan Murphy (70-30)

(13) Grant Williams def. (4) R.J. Barrett (66-34)

(5) Luke Maye def. (12) Markus Howard (68-32)

(6) Dedric Lawson def. (11) Shamorie Ponds (57-43)

(7) Kyle Guy def. (10) Tyus Battle (53-47)

(8) Caleb Martin def. (9) Rui Hachimura (54-46)

Here are our 1-16 rankings:

Preseason All-Americans (seed)

(1) Carsen Edwards, Jr., G, Purdue: Should average nearly 20 points a game and be the reason the Boilermakers are in the mix in the Big Ten ?making him a favorite for national player of the year.

(2) Zion Williamson, Fr., F, Duke: Williamson is a physical specimen that will dominate his position and be must-see every time out.

(3) Ethan Happ, Sr., F, Wisconsin: Happ has maximized everything out of his career and will lead the Badgers back to the NCAA tournament.

(4) R.J. Barrett, Fr., F, Duke: Barrett will provide a bookend to Williamson as the pair has the potential to average in the high teens every game.

(5) Luke Maye, Sr., F, North Carolina: Few players in the country have improved as much as Maye has in his career. He is the anchor for a team that could make a play for the title.

(6) Dedric Lawson, Jr., F, Kansas: The Memphis transfer could/should be the Big 12 player of the year and as a result be in contention for national honors, leading the Jayhawks to a possible top seed.

(7) Kyle Guy, Jr., G, Virginia: Guy is determined to erase the memory of the UMBC loss by taking the Cavs back to the top of the ACC. Guy has become one of the more reliable shooters under Tony Bennett.

(8) Caleb Martin, F, Sr., Nevada: Martin came back instead of staying in the NBA draft to join the most talented Wolf Pack roster ever. He has a chance to create a legacy with a trip to the Final Four.

(9) Rui Hachimura, Jr., F, Gonzaga: Hachimura has improved mightily in each season. He continues to embrace the role of being a go-to player on a roster that should make a run for the title.

(10) Tyus Battle, G, Jr., Syracuse: Battle flirted with staying in the NBA draft but he returns to lead the Orange a few steps further than the Sweet 16 last season. His numbers climbed during the season and he should be one of the more consistent scorers in the ACC.

(11) Shamarie Ponds, Jr., G, St. John’s: Ponds enters the season as one of the favorites for Big East player of the year. He is a must-watch guard who will have MSG rocking this season as the Red Storm rise toward an NCAA bid.

(12) Markus Howard, Jr., G, Marquette: Howard put up 52 in a road game at Providence. He could be one of the top scorers in the country. He’ll battle with Ponds for Big East player of the year and lead the Golden Eagles back to the NCAAs.

(13) Grant Williams, Jr., F, Tennessee: The SEC player of the year has a shot to go back-to-back as the best in the league with the top team in the conference. The Vols and Williams will compete for both throughout the season.

(14) Jordan Murphy, Sr., F, Minnesota: Murphy is a double-double machine, averaging over 16 and 11 each night out. Expect those numbers to rise as will the Gophers?win total toward an NCAA bid.

(15) Juwan Morgan, Sr., F, Indiana: Morgan has a high-profile co-star in freshman Romeo Langford. But Morgan will hold his own as a possible Big Ten player of the year candidate and one of the reasons the Hoosiers will thrive.

(16) Mike Daum, Sr., F, South Dakota State: The Jackrabbits could lead the country in scoring. He’s a likely lock to score at least 20 a game. And the Jackrabbits are due for a win in the NCAA tournament.
td_rationale:
This is a real message, as it communicates information about the college basketball season, player rankings, and the methodology of a fan vote for Player of the Year. It features specific details, statistics, and results, showing a high level of detail and complexity. Therefore, it is likely to be a real message. 

1

On Sunday night, the Oscars red carpet became a stage for two actresses who have bravely spoken out against Harvey Weinstein's sexual harassment. Ashley Judd and Mira Sorvino were among the earliest to share their stories of being victims of Weinstein, and their presence on the red carpet was a powerful symbol of the impact he had on their careers and the entire Hollywood industry.

Sorvino, who won an Oscar in 1996 for the Weinstein-released Mighty Aphrodite, revealed to The New Yorker that she believed turning down Weinstein's advances had discouraged other filmmakers from working with her. Judd, who spoke to The New York Times for the first blockbuster story about Weinstein, said at the time, "Women have been talking about Harvey amongst ourselves for a long time, and it’s simply beyond time to have the conversation publicly."

In December, Peter Jackson revealed that executives at Miramax had told him that Judd and Sorvino were "a nightmare to work with" and that they should be avoided at all costs. This was likely a part of the Miramax smear campaign against the actresses, and Jackson now suspects that false information was being fed to him about their talent.

Sorvino responded to Jackson's revelation with an emotional tweet, and Judd and Sorvino spoke about the goals of the Time's Up movement during the Vanity Fair Oscar Party. "I want people to know that this movement isn’t stopping, we’re going forward until we have an equitable and safe world for women," Sorvino said.

During the ceremony, Judd will present an award alongside two other women who have accused Weinstein: Annabella Sciorra and Salma Hayek. Sciorra, who claimed to The New Yorker that Weinstein raped her and that her career suffered as a result, seemed visibly overwhelmed to be onstage.

The united presence of Judd and Sorvino on the red carpet was a reminder of the striking and symbolic impact that a red carpet appearance can have. Stay up-to-date with all things Oscars with our live blog.

The mention of their past statements, reactions to Jackson's revelation, and their involvement in the Time's Up movement adds credibility to the message. Additionally, the reference to the upcoming presence of Judd and Sorvino at the award ceremony alongside other Weinstein accusers provides specific and verifiable information. Overall, the message is more likely to be real, so the veracity prediction is 1.

Therefore, the veracity of this message is 1.

Keaton Jones' heart-wrenching story has touched the hearts of Hollywood! The student's viral video detailing the bullying he faces at school has left viewers in tears. The young man's message is clear: it's not okay to bully someone just because they're different. "It's not your fault, but if you make fun of them, just don't let them bother you," he says, fiercely.

But Keaton's story isn't just about bullying. It's about the pain of not belonging anywhere. Keaton's mother, Kimberly, shared the video after she was too afraid to go to lunch at the school. Stephen Colbert Strikes Back at Donald Trump at the 2017 Emmy Awards! Watch the Epic Clash!

Stephen Colbert is at it again, and this time he's taking aim at the one and only, President Donald Trump! The late night host used his platform at the 2017 Emmy Awards to mercilessly mock the president, much to the delight of his adoring fans.

Colbert began his opening act by doing a song-and-dance number, poking fun at the various shows up for an Emmy this year. But there was a hidden message in there, a subtle jab at Trump. Can you guess what it is? The chorus of the song? "Everything is better on TV—including, in a slightly more veiled jab at Trump, 'treason'."

Once he finally took the stage, Colbert thanked first responders for their work following hurricanes in Texas and Florida. But he quickly pivoted to his Trump jokes, saying, "If he had won an Emmy, I bet he never would have run for president. So in a way, this is your fault. I thought you people loved morally compromised antiheroes. You liked Walter White; he's just Walter, much whiter."

But Colbert wasn't done yet. He had one final jab at the president before he left the stage. He brought out his secret weapon: Sean Spicer! Spicer appeared on stage behind a lectern to comment on the TV Academy gala's crowd size, saying, "This is the biggest audience to witness an Emmys, period, both in person and around the world."

Colbert's response? "Wow, that really soothes my fragile ego. Give it up for Melissa McCarthy, everybody."

This is just the latest in a long line of Trump jokes from Colbert, who has been honing his voice as David Letterman's replacement on The Late Show with Trump. Will he continue to take aim at the president at the Emmys? Only time will tell!

The public relations campaign surrounding Bruce Jenner's transition into Caitlyn Jenner has been highly effective, from the two-hour interview special with Diane Sawyer on "20/20" in April to the Vanity Fair cover reveal of Caitlyn in a bustier this week.

Alan Nierob, a seasoned showbiz publicist and former executive at Rogers & Cowan, has been guiding the strategy behind the scenes. Nierob previously helped Jenner handle crisis PR for Hollywood celebrities such as Robert Downey Jr. and Mel Gibson.

Jenner turned to Nierob for assistance in navigating the media attention that followed her coming out as transgender. Nierob had previously represented Jenner in the mid-1980s but had never been her official publicist. Instead, he acted as a friend and advisor.

Nierob worked with Jenner's manager and attorney to persuade the New York Times to abandon a story about Jenner being a cross-dresser during a career downturn in the mid-1980s. He used all the PR pressure tactics at his disposal, including strenuous denials, questioning the motives of sources, and emphasizing the potential consequences for Jenner and her family.

Nierob then helped Jenner prepare for her landmark TV interview with Sawyer and began work on the campaign to explain her transformation. The first promotion for Jenner's upcoming E! docu-series was announced during the "20/20" interview, and the Vanity Fair cover reveal of Caitlyn's new name and look coincided with the launch of her Twitter account.

Jenner has been shooting material for the docu-series "I Am Cait" while on the road and has been busy promoting her new role as an advocate for the transgender community. Sources close to Jenner say that she is "on a mission to save lives and make a difference."

Johnny Depp has come to a settlement with The Management Group, ending his legal action taken against the company in January 2017. The actor's spokesperson issued a statement on Monday, stating that Depp is pleased to have resolved the matter and will now be able to fully focus on his artistic endeavors.

Depp initially sued The Management Group, accusing them of "self-dealing and gross misconduct." In the lawsuit, he claimed that the company was taking an excessive 5% commission of his income, even if he wasn't earning any income himself. He also accused the company of living an "ultra-extravagant lifestyle" that cost him more than $2 million per month to maintain.

The Management Group then filed a cross-complaint, accusing Depp of living an "ultra-extravagant lifestyle" that he couldn't afford. The complaint listed several examples of Depp's alleged extravagances, including spending $75 million on 14 residences, $18 million to buy and renovate a 150-foot yacht, and $30,000 per month on expensive wine.

Despite the legal battle, Depp's spokesperson stated that the settlement is a "further demonstration that Johnny is determined to take firm action to protect his personal and artistic reputation in the interests of his family and his career." With the matter settled, Depp is now able to focus on his upcoming projects, including the second leg of the Hollywood Vampires tour and the release of "Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald" in November.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed information provided and the fact that it includes quotes from Depp's spokesperson, it is more likely that this message is real. The specifics of the legal battle and the settlement indicate that this is a genuine update on the situation. Additionally, the mention of Depp's upcoming projects and the statement from his spokesperson add to the credibility of the message. Therefore, it is likely to be a real message, so the prediction is 1.

She also promoted an earlier version of the LuMee case in July 2016 on Instagram, with a link to Amazon and the caption, "Hey Guys! LuMee cases are featured today as Amazon’s Prime Deal of the Day. Best deal ever! #PrimeDay #LuMee."

After taking a selfie with then-presidential candidate Hillary Clinton at a fundraiser, Kardashian used the encounter to later promote LuMee. Clinton recalled in January 2016 on the "Ellen DeGeneres Show" that Kardashian showed her a phone case with lights all around it, and Clinton had been searching for something similar. After this, Kardashian tweeted, "Selfies about to be LIT!!! The secret to my selfies http://Lumee.com."

Gossip Cop has reached out to SnapLight, LuMee, and Harooni for comment on Kardashian's promotion of the LuMee case. A representative for Kardashian claimed that the patent lawsuit filed by SnapLight was meritless.

In a shocking turn of events, Demi Lovato has seemingly thrown shade at Kathy Griffin on Twitter, after the comedian's controversial press conference about her Donald Trump photo shoot. The 24-year-old singer tweeted, "I find it funny when bullies play the victim."

The tweet read, "So @kathygriffin states she will continue making fun of people, kinda like she made fun of my daughter @ddlovato for going into treatment."

This isn't the first time Lovato and the stand-up comic have taken their feud to social media. In 2014, a fan asked Griffin to call out the "biggest douche celebrity." She responded, "Probably Debbie Lovato."

I, along with millions of other women, have always admired the bronzed appearance of male celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio, George Clooney, and Bradley Cooper. We have always believed that having a tan, whether natural or artificial, makes a man look healthier and more attractive.

However, there seems to be a stigma surrounding men using self-tanning products. It is often perceived as a sign of insecurity or a desperate attempt to look younger. But is this really the case?

Self-tanning products have become increasingly popular among both men and women, and there are many benefits to using them. For instance, a self-tan can help to accentuate muscles, cover imperfections, smooth out skin tone, and even mask cellulite. Additionally, it can help to boost confidence and make a person more attractive to the opposite sex.

There are many self-tanning products specifically designed for men, and they are just as effective as their female counterparts. Self-tanning can be used on an ongoing basis to maintain a healthy glow, rather than relying on tanning beds or sun exposure, which can lead to skin cancer and wrinkles.

In conclusion, there are many reasons why men should feel encouraged to use self-tanning products. It is a safe and natural alternative to tanning beds and sun exposure, and it can have numerous benefits for both men and women. So, the next time you see a man with a nice tan, don't be surprised, it's just another sign of a man taking pride in his appearance.

On Thursday, a new article was released in which the author posed the question to country singer Miranda Lambert about her potential involvement in political activism. When asked if she believed there was an opportunity for her to create issue-oriented songs like Loretta Lynn, Lambert responded that she was a firm believer in not using her platform for anything other than music. She felt that music was an escape from reality and did not want to be subjected to political preaching during her shows. When pressed, Lambert reiterated her stance and felt that political discussions would only lead to division and not necessarily result in a change of opinion.

Lambert's decision to avoid political activism aligns with that of another female country icon, Reba McEntire, who argued on "The View" that entertainers should not discuss politics. In a separate interview with Billboard, Lambert discussed her decision not to do press for her album, The Weight of These Wings, in order to avoid discussing her divorce from Blake Shelton. She simply did not feel the need to talk about the record.

In the article, Lambert also revealed that she co-wrote "Vice" the day the split from Shelton became public in 2015. She stated that she approached the situation "with guns blazing" and did not want to create a breakup record. She felt that the song was the perfect way to express her feelings about the situation and did not want to give away any more details than necessary. Overall, Lambert's decision to avoid political activism and keep her music focused on her personal experiences aligns with her desire to provide an escape for her listeners.

content:
Dear Bravoholic's,

I'm here to share with you my journey of watching the Real Housewives of New Jersey on Peacock and the Bravo app. It's been a wild ride, full of ups and downs, just like the lives of these women.

As I watched Melissa and Teresa navigate their way through family dynamics, I couldn't help but feel a sense of admiration for them. Despite the challenges they've faced, they've come so far and it's amazing to see. Family relationships can be complicated and there's no one right way to do things. Each family is unique, and sometimes it takes a lot of trial and error to figure out what works best. I can relate to Melissa's desire to make her parents feel loved and special, even if it means going to great lengths.

I also have to give props to Teresa for her discipline in this fitness competition. While I may not have the same level of ambition, I can appreciate the stress-relieving benefits of working out. However, I don't think I could ever have the same level of discipline as her, even if I wanted to.

As for Marge, I love her fierce business sense and the idea of her pajama line is intriguing. But the fact that she sleeps naked is just too much information for me!

Dolores and Frank's relationship serves as a great example of how divorced couples should behave. They are truly amazing role models. As for Frankie Jr., I hope he takes time to visit his mom and show her some love.

I must say, I was worried about how Dolores would react to Danielle. Paterson Dolores is a force to be reckoned with, and I can only imagine the kind of reaction she would have.

I wish Melissa a very happy birthday, and I can't wait to see what she gets up to at Rails. The party looks like it's going to be a blast, especially with Melissy drinking her weight in water.

As for arranged marriages and chaperoned dates, I have a story to share. I met my husband in a unique way, and it was love at first sight. We knew we were meant to be together, and our families approved. We got married on Labor Day of 2002, and it was the event of the year.

Now, back to Melissa's party. The cake is absolutely stunning, and I love that she doesn't take herself too seriously. The fact that cake is flying everywhere and nobody cares is just a testament to the joy that comes with celebrating life.

As a woman who has always dreamed of becoming a mother, Khloe Kardashian's recent visit to her fertility doctor has left her heart heavy with fear and uncertainty. The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star, 32, went in for a routine check-up, but little did she know that it would lead to an ultrasound to determine if she was on track for a healthy pregnancy.

"I just came here for a doctor's appointment and had no idea I was about to get an ultrasound," Khloe says in a clip from the upcoming episode of the E! show. "This whole thing is snowballing and moving really fast."

As she waits for the ultrasound, Khloe's sister Kim joins her, and the mood is light with jokes about Khloe already being pregnant. But when the doctor enters, the mood turns serious. "We're looking to see there's nothing that will get in the way of a healthy pregnancy," he explains. "There are fewer follicles than I anticipated from a normal 32-year-old."

Khloe's response is heartbreaking. "Shut the f**k up," she says. "This is definitely not at all how I thought this appointment would go. What if I can't get pregnant?"

Khloe is currently dating basketball player Tristan Thompson, and while there's no suggestion they're ready to start a family just yet, it was recently claimed the couple is "very serious" about each other. Khloe has been feeling the happiest she's ever been thanks to Tristan, and she recently gushed about their relationship in an interview.

But Khloe's sister Kim has had her own fertility issues over the years. She's a proud mom to two children - North and Saint - but has been open in interviews about her struggles to fall pregnant and medical conditions while pregnant. On an episode of KUWTK earlier this year, Kim was warned that she could "bleed to death" if she falls pregnant again. Her doctor, Paul Crane, told her: "Here's what I think, your pregnancies, you had toxaemia, you had a retained placenta, very traumatic, we're always worried about the next serious complication. I think the potential fear of the whole situation is legitimate.

"You never know that you might not have the same type of problem that might be more serious this time. You're always taking a little bit of a chance. There are situations where retained placenta could be life and death."

As Khloe waits for her ultrasound results, her fears and anxieties mount. Will she be able to have a healthy pregnancy? Will she be able to start a family? These are questions that weigh heavily on her heart, and the fate of her relationship with Tristan is uncertain.

"The Love Story of Deontay Wilder and Telli Swift: A Tale of True Love Amidst the Fierce World of Boxing"

Deontay Wilder's rise to the top of the boxing world has been met with much fanfare, but what many may not know is that he has a partner by his side who has been there every step of the way - his fiancee, Telli Swift.

Born on January 24, 1987, in Zambales, Philippines, Telli Swift was raised in Japan and later moved to California. She began her modelling career at the young age of three and went on to appear in a variety of beauty pageants.

It was in 2015 that Telli and Deontay crossed paths for the first time. According to Telli, they saw each other at check-in, then again at TSA, before Deontay finally spoke to her while they were both going to their gates.

However, it wasn't until two weeks before their family reunion in Alabama that things really took off between them. According to Telli, Deontay reached out to her via Instagram DMs after she was released from the hospital following an infection in her leg.

Despite initially being reluctant to propose, Deontay eventually did so on an episode of Wags Atlanta. He said, "I love the girl though. She got my heart. That's my baby, that's my best friend."

The proposal took place on February 15, 2018, and was timed to coincide with their child's gender reveal party, where they found out they were having a daughter.

This will be Deontay's second marriage, as he divorced his first wife, Jessica Scales-Wilder, in 2017 after eight years of marriage. Telli has kept a low profile since then, focusing on being a partner to Deontay and a mother to their daughter.

Together, Deontay and Telli have faced many challenges, including the pressure that comes with being in the public eye. However, they have stood strong and supported each other through it all.

As they prepare for their future together, let us celebrate the love story of Deontay Wilder and Telli Swift - a love story that is truly inspiring and a testament to the power of true love.

The actress who brought laughter to millions through her role as Gloria on Modern Family posed nude for the Naked Issue of Women's Health Magazine. At the age of 45, Sofia Vergara stood proud and confident, stripped down to her birthday suit on a block of wood.

She opened up about what it meant to her to be posing nude at her age, saying, "Times have changed, and it's not like before when only young girls would make the cover of a magazine." The actress accepted her body and skin for what it is and what it is not, admitting that she is 45 and even if she wanted to, she cannot be perfect.

Vergara acknowledged that her body is changing, and she can see it happening, but she doesn't hate it or get upset by it. She wants to look her age, and people who are constantly trying to look younger will eventually go crazy. Staying healthy and fit is important to her, but working out is torture. Despite this, she continues to do it often because she sees the importance of staying healthy and fit. It's not about having muscles or cut abs because that would take too much effort!

The actress mentioned that she had bad knees and thin bones, and wished she could be a little bit more athletic. She also said her "gigantic boobs" have only gotten bigger with time, which makes it hard to work out.

Working hard is one of the things that Sofia Vergara believes in the most, which has led her to her many successes in her acting career. She said that she wasn't always the "youngest" or "most intelligent" woman in the room, but she was always "the hardest working one."

"Dreams don't happen if you just sit down and accept things."

Jill Messick, a veteran studio executive and producer, passed away on Wednesday after years of struggling with depression. The Hollywood Reporter reported that she was "victimized" after becoming embroiled in the Harvey Weinstein-Rose McGowan allegations.

Messick worked at Miramax as a production executive from 1997 to 2003 and served as McGowan's manager in January 1997. In a statement following her death, her family said that Messick was "collateral damage" in the story.

In January 1997, Messick set up a meeting between McGowan and Weinstein during the Sundance Film Festival. Following the meeting, McGowan told Messick what had happened, but did not use the word "rape." Despite this, Messick recognized that something untoward had happened and immediately went to her bosses to recount McGowan's story. They told her that they would handle the situation, and the arrangements between McGowan and Weinstein were then negotiated without Messick's knowledge.

Ten months later, Messick was hired by Miramax as an executive at Miramax Films working in production in Los Angeles. However, in recent months, McGowan's constant press attention has led to Weinstein releasing documents, including an email that Messick wrote to him months prior to the first New York Times piece coming out. In this email, Messick offered the truth based on what she remembered McGowan telling her about the Sundance account.

Messick's family said that seeing her name in headlines again and again, as part of one person's attempt to gain more attention for her personal cause, along with Weinstein's attempt to vindicate himself, was devastating for her. It broke her, who was just starting to get her life back on track.

The media is a powerful tool, and it is important to use it responsibly to accurately expose criminals and predators while protecting the truth of third parties. Words matter, and what we say can have just as much impact as our actions. We must take a moment to consider the ramifications and consequences of what we say and do.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed account of events and the emotional impact described by Messick's family, it is more likely that this message is real. The specific timeline, interactions, and emotions described provide a sense of authenticity to the story. Messick's involvement in the Harvey Weinstein-Rose McGowan allegations, her actions following the meeting, and the subsequent consequences on her life all contribute to the credibility of the message. Therefore, it is predicted to be a real message (1).
cs_rationale: This message appears to be real, as it contains specific details about Jill Messick's career and involvement with the Harvey Weinstein-Rose McGowan allegations. Additionally, the details provided regarding events and interactions involving Messick are detailed and specific. The message also includes commentary about the responsibilities of the media and the need for accurate reporting, further suggesting its veracity. Therefore, the predicted veracity of this message is 1.

The 2018 Screen Actors Guild Awards?In Memoriam segment paid tribute to the late and great David Cassidy, Roger Moore, Adam West, Jerry Lewis, and Bill Paxton, who left us all too soon. Their legacies live on through the films and television shows they left behind, but their absence leaves a void in the hearts of their fans.

David Cassidy, the former teen heartthrob best known for his role as Keith Partridge on the hit series The Partridge Family, passed away on Nov. 21 at the age of 67. His dementia diagnosis was revealed exclusively to PEOPLE in February 2017, and he bravely fought the disease until the end.

Roger Moore, the beloved James Bond actor, passed away on May 23 at the age of 89 after a long battle with leukemia. He will always be remembered for his iconic portrayal of 007 in the 1970s and 80s.

Adam West, best known for his turn as Gotham City's Caped Crusader, passed away on June 9 at the age of 88 after a short battle with leukemia. His career spanned six decades of film, stage, and voice work, and he will always be remembered as a true legend of the silver screen.

Jerry Lewis, the comedy king who brought joy to generations of moviegoers on both sides of the Atlantic, passed away on March 20 at the age of 91. His manic style and quick wit will be missed by all who knew him.

Bill Paxton, a talented actor who rose to fame in the 1990s with roles in blockbusters like Terminator and Aliens, passed away on Feb. 25 at the age of 61. He earned accolades for his role as treasure hunter Brock Lovett in Titanic, and later for his performance in the hit TV series Big Love.

These five stars, along with the many others who were honored at the In Memoriam segment, will always be remembered for the impact they made on the entertainment industry and the lives of those around them. Their legacies will live on through their work, and their fans will always keep them close to their hearts.

"Are You Allowing Your Child to Watch a Teenage Nightmare? The Terrifying Truth About Netflix's 13 Reasons Why"

A concerned parent is at a loss as to whether or not their 13-year-old daughter should watch the Netflix show, 13 Reasons Why. The show has become an obsession among her friends, but the news articles she's been reading are warning of the graphic depictions of suicide, bullying, and forced sex that may be too much for her to handle.

The show, based on a popular YA novel, is rated TV-MA and contains explicit content that may not be suitable for viewers under 17. However, it has been heavily marketed to adolescents, with a personal social media campaign from Executive Producer and powerful teen influencer, Selena Gomez.

The Mediatrician® has issued a warning, stating that the show may be dangerous for kids to watch. The intense emotions, confusion, and behaviors of the show's characters can be disturbing to any viewer, especially younger viewers who are still developing their brain executive functions. The show may also be interpreted by young viewers as normal adolescent behavior, leading to a misunderstanding of the seriousness of teen suicide.

Furthermore, the show neglects to address the primary reason for the main character's suicide, which is depression. The show presents a harsh and untrue message that Hannah's classmates actually caused her death. The missed opportunity to describe how depression feels and how it looks to others is the show's greatest failure.

As a parent, it's important to discuss the themes of the show with your child and help them process it in a healthy way. It's also crucial to identify the people in your child's life to whom they can turn when they feel sad, lonely, or helpless.

In conclusion, while 13 Reasons Why may be marketed as "teen drama," it's important to be aware of the graphic content and the potential dangers it may pose to your child.
td_rationale: This message is highly likely to be a real message. It addresses the concerns of a parent regarding the appropriateness of their 13-year-old daughter watching the Netflix show, 13 Reasons Why. It discusses the warnings about the graphic content and potential negative impact on young viewers, as well as the show's failure to address the main character's depression as the primary reason for her suicide. Additionally, the message emphasizes the importance of parents discussing the themes of the show with their children and helping them process it in a healthy way. Therefore, the veracity of this message is likely to be real. I predict its veracity to be 1.
cs_rationale: The article raises valid concerns about whether the Netflix show "13 Reasons Why" is appropriate for young viewers, particularly due to its graphic depictions of sensitive topics like suicide, bullying, and sexual assault. Despite its popularity among adolescents, the show's TV-MA rating indicates it contains explicit content unsuitable for viewers under 17. Critics, including the Mediatrician®, warn that the intense emotions and portrayal of teen suicide may be disturbing and potentially harmful, especially without addressing depression as the main cause. Parents are advised to discuss these themes openly with their children and provide guidance on processing such content in a healthy manner, emphasizing the importance of seeking help when needed.

SCARLETT JOHANSSON GETS DIVORCED FROM ROMAIN DAURIAC AFTER CLASH OVER WHERE DAUGHTER ROSE SHALL BE RAISED

Actress Scarlett Johansson has officially parted ways with her husband, Romain Dauriac, after a long and bitter custody dispute over their 3-year-old daughter Rose Dorothy Dauriac. According to Page Six, the couple has finalized their divorce and reached a settlement in Manhattan Supreme Court on Tuesday.

In a joint statement, the ex-couple revealed that they remain close friends and co-parents with a shared commitment to raising their daughter in a loving and compassionate environment. However, their divorce was not an easy one, as Dauriac fought Johansson's request for primary physical custody, insisting that the child be raised in France, and noting that Johansson's busy work schedule requires heavy traveling.

Johansson, who was previously married to Ryan Reynolds, filed for divorce on March 7, asking for primary physical custody of their daughter. Dauriac, on the other hand, believed that the child should be raised in France, and argued that Johansson's busy work schedule makes it impossible for her to have primary custody.

Despite the drama, Johansson maintained that she would never comment on the dissolution of her marriage, and asked other parties involved and the media to do the same, out of respect for her desires as a parent and for all working moms.

The actress, who has recently been linked with Saturday Night Live star Colin Jost and her attorney, Kevin Yorn, tied the knot with Dauriac in a private wedding ceremony in 2014. The actress was previously married to Ryan Reynolds from 2008 to 2011.

content:
"Big Little Lies" has announced the addition of two new cast members for its upcoming second season, as well as the return of several characters from the show's first outing.

Crystal Fox, best known for her role in "In the Heat of the Night," will join the show as a series regular, playing the character of Elizabeth Howard. Additionally, Mo McRae, previously seen in "Pitch," will play Michael Perkins in a recurring role.

Although details about the characters they will play have not been revealed, it is known that they will be series regulars.

HBO has also confirmed that four key characters from the first season will return: Kathryn Newton as Madeline's (Reese Witherspoon) daughter Abigail; Sarah Sokolovic as Tori Bachman; Robin Weigert as Celeste's (Nicole Kidman) therapist Dr. Amanda Reisman; and Merrin Dungey as Adrienne Quinlan, the detective investigating the death of Perry (Alexander Skarsgard).

The second season, like the first, will be written and executive produced by David E. Kelley and will be based, in part, on a story by Liane Moriarty. Andrea Arnold has signed on to direct all seven installments, replacing Season 1 director Jean-Marc Vallée.

Executive producers on the series include David E. Kelley, Andrea Arnold, Bruna Papandrea, Jean-Marc Vallée, Nathan Ross, and Gregg Fienberg.

The first season was a critical and commercial success, earning 16 Emmy nominations and eight wins, effectively sweeping the Limited Series categories in September. The drama also won four Golden Globes, including a supporting actress award for Laura Dern.

Selena Gomez recently spoke out about her relationship with The Weeknd and her decision to reunite with Justin Bieber.

"I'm really proud of the true friendship I had with The Weeknd," Gomez told Billboard. "We ended things as best friends and that was genuinely about encouraging and caring for each other."

She also addressed rumors that she was giving Bieber another chance due to drama with The Weeknd. "I'm 25. I'm not 18, or 19, or 20," Gomez said. "I cherish people who have really impacted my life. So maybe before, it could have been forcing something that wasn't right. But that doesn't mean caring for someone ever goes away."

Gomez was alsohonored by Billboard as the outlet's "Woman of the Year" and got candid about her self-esteem after undergoing a kidney transplant earlier this summer. "It was really hard in the beginning," she said about her surgery scar. "I remember looking at myself in the mirror completely naked and thinking about all the things that I used to bitch about and just asking, 'Why?'" She also revealed that there used to be "someone" in her life "who pointed out all the things that I didn't feel great about with myself," but she's since gained a new confidence about her body. "I just think for me, it could be my eyes, my round face, my ears, my legs, my scar. I don't have perfect abs, but I feel like I'm wonderfully made."
